content.description: The gem of the wall. Start standing with left hand on a small hold and right hand pressed up into a nice edge, or any other way you can figure out how to get attached to the wall. Move up and right on good holds and work your feet up before a throw to the lip. Top out and downclimb off the right (North) arete of the boulder by Drury Lane. A sit start on this would be seriously hard and very cool.
content.location: Center right of the Nice Boulder East face. To the right of the hollow flake.

content.description: Sit start with a good right hand on the arete and your left on a micro edge sidepull. One tough move to stand up and then enjoy the jugs up the rest of the arete. Reverse the route to come down.
content.location: Far right side of the Nice Boulder east face.

content.description: Sit start low on undercling and sidepull features. Move up and over the bulge on nice edges. Climbs much better than it looks. Top out, but then you may want to drop off/downclimb back to the start as opposed to scrambling off the back side. The downclimb on the back is a blank and tall 5th class slab covered in lichen. Alternatively, head over to the Drury Lane arete to downclimb on easier terrain.
content.location: Far left of the east face of the Nice Boulder.

content.description: The first developed face in the area. As the name suggests, a nice boulder that deserves some love. Gets sun almost all day in the winter and is very sheltered from wind. All routes are on the impressive East face.
